problem.markdown:
Same set-up as above: Design a simply-supported beam with a span of 10m that supports a distributed load of 50kN/m.
>>What happens to the magnitude of the bending moment if you increase the span of the simply-supported beam? Assume that the distributed load remains the same.<< ( ) The magnitude of the moment decreases ( ) The magnitude of the moment remains the same (x) The magnitude of the moment increases
[explanation] As the span increases the moment will increase since a greater span results in a larger moment at the middle both because the load increases and the distance increases. [explanation]
